name: liquid crystal display production, unmounted, mobile device | liquid crystal display, unmounted, mobile device | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24581/documentation

This activity represents the production of a thin unmounted liquid crystal display for the use in mobile devices (smartphone, tablet). kg was chosen as a unit for the dataset to be scalable. It includes materials for the steel frame, glass cover, backlight and controller board for the display. Data is based on an LCA of the Fairphone 1 with a 4.3 inch (960x540, 16:9) LCD display (weight of 0.04563 kg). ;Source: Güvendik, M. (2014). From smartphone to futurephone: assessing the environmental impacts of different circular economy scenarios of a smartphone using LCA.

From reception of materials and auxiliares at the factory gate. 

The activity includes the materials, processes and energy use (included through processing datasets) for the production of an unmounted liquid crystal display used in mobile applications. Data on factory, disposal and packaging are not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data for composition are from 2014 but represent current technology.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average electronic device.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Literature source points to manufacturing in China. The dataset includes processing of steel and plastic as well as the sputtering and assembly of the LCD display.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data from Güvendik, 2014 was scaled by mass to fit the reference product of 1kg. The original unit has a weight of 0.04563 kg.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: In the study (Güvendik, 2014), the display was dismanteled and the components identified and weighed.

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value. The display has an area of 51.7cm2, scaled to 1 kg by weight (factor 22) and an energy use of 0.1 kWh/cm2 from Ercan (2016). The total energy use is 113.3 kWh. The 'liquid crystal display, minor components, auxilliaries and assembly effort' provides 18.7357 and the rest is added through this exchange.

Ercan, M., Malmodin, J., Bergmark, P., Kimfalk, E., & Nilsson, E. (2016). Life cycle assessment of a smartphone. ICT for Sustainability 2016.
